tasks: Higher Order Elliptic Equations on Nonsmooth Domains
results: Lp Dirichlet problem is uniquely solvable for certain ranges of p
Sharp ranges of p for W ℓ,p well-posedness
title: Higher Order Elliptic Equations on Nonsmooth Domains.pdf
abstract: In 1995, D. Jerison and C. Kenig in [10] considered the the inhomogeneous Dirichlet problem ∆u = f on Ω, u = 0 on ∂Ωin Lipschitz domains. One of their main results shows that the W 1,p estimate holds for the sharp range 3 2 −ε < p < 3 + ε for d ≥3 and 4 3 −ε < p < 4 + ε if d = 2. Although the argument employed in [10] yield optimal results, they rely on an essential fashion on the maximum principle and, as such, do not readily adapt to higher-order case. By using a new method, the aim of this paper is to establish an extension of their theorem for higher order inhomogeneous elliptic equations on bounded Lipschitz and convex domains, uniform W ℓ,p estimates are obtained for p in certain ranges. Especially, compare to the result in [19] for biharmonic equation, a larger, sharp, range of p′s was obtained in this paper.
